balanced.insight: Exceptionally high vitamin C with very low calories and minimal sugar make lemon an excellent nutrient-dense addition.
pros: Extremely high vitamin C (51% DV per lemon)

heart_health.insight: Zero cholesterol, minimal sodium, and excellent vitamin C support cardiovascular health and vessel integrity.
pros: Vitamin C supports collagen in blood vessels
cons: No vitamin K for clotting regulation

muscle_building.insight: Minimal protein and lack of essential amino acids make lemon unsuitable for muscle building as a primary food.
pros: Low calorie for lean muscle goals
cons: No vitamin D or significant minerals

energy.insight: Low calorie and low sugar provide gentle sustained energy without spikes, but not a primary energy source.
pros: Natural citric acid for metabolic support
cons: No B-complex vitamins for energy metabolism
Lacks protein and fat for sustained fuel

weight_management.insight: Among the best foods for weight management with extreme low calorie density, minimal sugar, and high satiety from fiber.
cons: Acidic nature may irritate on empty stomach

brain_focus.insight: Vitamin C provides antioxidant protection for neurons, but lacks key brain-building fats and B-vitamins.
pros: High vitamin C protects brain cells
cons: No omega-3 DHA for brain structure
No vitamin E for cognitive protection

gut_health.insight: Good fiber content and natural citric acid support digestive health and nutrient absorption.
pros: Pectin in peel supports gut lining

blood_sugar.insight: Exceptional blood sugar management with very low sugar, low glycemic impact, and fiber that slows absorption.
pros: Citric acid may improve insulin sensitivity

pros: High vitamin C for collagen production
cons: No vitamin D for calcium absorption
Minimal vitamin K for bone protein

cons: Citric acid may irritate inflamed tissues
